document.docAuthor: Alencar, I. D. C. C. & Azevedo, C. O.
document.masterDocTitle: Definition of the coronatus species-group (Hymenoptera: Bethylidae, Dissomphalus) with description of thirteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Definition of the coronatus species-group (Hymenoptera: Bethylidae, Dissomphalus) with description of thirteen new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of Neotropical
coronatus
species group of
Dissomphalus

paragraph.keyLead:
2 ( 1 ). Ventral ramus with apical part converging mesad, apex narrow (
Fig. 5
); paramere with base developed in dorsal view
.............................................. D. auritus
sp. nov.

- Ventral ramus with apical part straight, apex rounded and slightly dilated (
Fig. 31
); paramere not so dilated in dorsal view (
Fig. 32
)
.......................... D. sinatus
sp. nov.

3 ( 1 ). Ventral ramus with apex thick and inner margin strongly excavated before apex (
Fig. 20
)
............................................................................................... D. galeatus
sp. nov.

5 ( 4 ). Paramere with apical margin strongly concave and with small tooth medially (
Fig. 15
)
........................................................................................... D. decussatus
sp. nov.

6 ( 5 ). Dorsal body with apex divided into three arms in ventral view (
Fig. 30
), dorsal arm directed slightly mesad, median arm longer than dorsal one, directed laterad, ventral arm shorter than others with apex thin and folded ventrally and laterad; crown-process large, 0.25 x aedeagus length (
Fig. 29
)
................................ D. ramosus
sp. nov.

7 ( 6 ). Dorsal body with apex wide and arched ventrally (
Fig. 14
)
.... D. declinatus
sp. nov.
- Dorsal body with apex narrow and directed laterad ( Figs. 8 , 25 )............................. 8

- Ventral ramus with apex straight (
Fig. 7
); apex of dorsal body with serrate crest-like ventral projection in lateral view (
Fig. 9
)
................................. D. coronatus
sp. nov.

9 ( 3 ). Dorsal body with two distinct pairs of apical lobes, inner margin of outer pair with three thorns ( Fig. 3, 4 )
............................................................... D. aculeatus
sp. nov.

11 ( 10 ). Cuspis with apex dilated and truncate; outer lobes of aedeagus with spoon-like structure (
Fig. 23
)
............................................................................ D. hirtus
sp. nov.

12 ( 8 ). Inner margin of ventral ramus microserrate (
Fig. 10
); apex of dorsal body biramous; crown-process large (
Fig. 11
)
.................................................. D. culteratus
sp. nov.

- Inner margin of ventral ramus not serrate (
Fig. 18
); apex of dorsal body with no arm, dorsal margin of dorsal body sinuous; crown-process small (
Fig. 19
) .......................
..................................................................................................... D. flexuosus
sp. nov.
